title: I will be creating a LoL orchestral theme for the top voted champ at least once a week. Here's Leona

embed.description: The first release of my new champion series, where I will release a song inspired by a LoL champ at least once a week!

body:
Polls for voting (there's a limit of the number of entries on strawpoll). Please keep in mind that if a champion is voted for the most it does not guarantee I will do that champion. The votes will be taken into account, but sometimes it's hard to find inspiration for some things. I will do my best though

http://strawpoll.me/4387481 Aatrox - Garen
http://strawpoll.me/4387499 Gnar - Master Yi
http://strawpoll.me/4387517 Miss Fortune - Sona
http://strawpoll.me/4387541 Soraka - Zyra

replies.body: Good stuff!!!

I want to subscribe to your work and just stream it to my earballs every day.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/d5/e2/9f/d5e29f48a593e065594939c9e90c0331.jpg

<3
Upvoting this just because of Cheryl/Carol.

FUCKING AWESOME

Thanks for not sticking to the stereotypes Riot uses and creating something your way.

Would you say you drew inspiration from TSFH?
Thomas Bergersen and TSFH are huge inspirations, yes.

Cool! Would you consider producing something more into Nick Phoenix's style?(cohessive use of traditional instrumental organs, lack of vocals, clear deffinition of beginning-middle-ending, melody that feels like a journey to another world compared to Bergersen's feeling of:"let's go on a adventure" kind of production) <=personal interpretation of a person's whos only relationship with music making is a younger brother that plays the saxophone e.g. I'm talking out of my ass.

Personaly I would see that style fitting more to champions who have more subbtle and dimensional struggles. It also help give a bit of personality instead of just straight up epicness. As always though it's up to you, you have the creative freedom to do whatever the fuck you want and screw other's opinions, I'm just throwing stuff out there hoping you won't mind.

Last but not least, I've always wondered how such productions happen. Do you use programs(I don't need to know which ones, just how)? Do you synthesize samples together? Do you play the instruments yourself and then produce with the means of digital media? How did you get vocals in? Were they premade samples and you just "put" them in? Whatever you'd like to respond to I'd really apriciate since it would greatly satisfy my curiosity. 

PS. For the past couple of days I've been really obsessed with Transistor's soundtrack: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zA1jRmAYfU
Would this style interest you?
Browsing your soundcloud makes me want to try my hand at writing game music, well done! Your Leona piece in particular is spectacular, keep up work like that and you'll go places!
